title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [10 december 1868]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [10 December 1868]
text: 10 Dec. 1868thursdayThursday evening I have just received this letter from mrMr. heyddheyde i feel real sad to think poor han has lost her thumb but if the bone was affected it was the only thing that could be done i wrote a letter to her last week a good letter and i gave mrMr. heydeHeyde hint of his insult to you and not giving han the letter i wrote nothing ugly to him for fear it would be worse for han) i think very likely she will get better now if she dontdon't fret about it it is good itsit's on her left hand as she can sew without iti got your letter Walter dear on tuesdayTuesday with 2 dollars all safe Jeff has gone to bostonBoston but will be back to night They talk of going to st louLou isSt. Louis next week i dontdon't know how it will be mattyMatty is quite smart but cant doodo much she sews but cantcan't doodo much else the children is well and awfullawful troublesome i cantcan't writ it but i have got so far through the weather is very cold indeed you must come if you can walterWalter dear as you spoke offof Jeffy and all are going to board when they go back they cantcan't come to washingtonWashigton this time Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [10 December 1868]
